public_adjuster_products.name: United Policyholders
usecases: Assistance with insurance claim documentation and negotiation
Representation for policyholders in insurance claim process
solutions: Tips and tools for handling insurance claims independently
Assistance in finding and hiring licensed public adjusters
key_features: Provides guidance on questions to ask before hiring a public adjuster
Offers a 'Find Help' directory to locate professionals
Advocates for consumer protections related to public adjusters

public_adjuster.name: NAPIA (National Association of Public Insurance Adjusters)
usecases: Assisting policyholders in preparing, filing, and adjusting insurance claims
Managing every detail of the claim and working closely with the insured
Inspecting the loss site immediately, analyzing damages, and assembling claim support data
Determining current replacement costs and exclusively serving the client, not the insurance company
public_adjuster.solutions: Assistance in property loss adjustment, guiding insureds through first party property insurance claims, and adherence to a strict code of ethics and rules of professional conduct
key_features: Analysis of damages and assembly of claim support data
Exclusive service to the client, not the insurance company
Adherence to a strict code of ethics and rules of professional conduct

public_adjuster_product.name: Adjusters International
usecases: Handling property damage insurance claims for homes, businesses, and commercial properties
Providing expert representation to ensure maximum insurance claim settlements
Assisting in expediting the insurance claim process
solutions: Thorough assessment and documentation of insurance claims
Proactive negotiation for maximum claim amount
Challenging insurance company's offer if necessary
Complete transparency and expert advice to lower stress for clients
key_features: Thorough assessment and documentation of claims
Proactive negotiation for maximum claim amount
Complete transparency and expert advice for clients

usecases: Becoming a licensed and bonded insurance professional
Advocating for policyholders
Filing, negotiating, and settling claims on behalf of homeowners/policyholders
Obtaining satisfactory claim recovery for clients
Interpreting and evaluating client's policy
Preparing and supporting client's claim
Appraising damages and preparing estimates
Re-opening claims to negotiate for more money if discrepancies are found
www.reedc.com.solutions: Training and certification for individuals to become licensed Public Adjusters in New York

usecases: Representing the financial interests of the insured named in the policy
Complying with licensing requirements
Renewing the license
Completing continuing education
Reporting actions to the Commissioner
public_adjuster.solutions: Obtaining and renewing a Public Adjuster license in Nevada

Qualification Requirements: Being 18 years of age or older
Being employed by the policy holder
Passing an examination for the license and lines of authority requested
Submitting a set of fingerprints for a criminal history background check
key_features.Continuing Education: 24 hours of education during the license term, with 3 hours in ethics
key_features.Renewal Process: Electronically submit the renewal application and fees through Sircon or NIPR
key_features.Record Retention: Keeping a record of transactions under the license for three (3) years
key_features.Reporting of Actions: Reporting administrative actions and criminal prosecutions to the Commissioner

priceAndPlans.ownerPolicy: $1,046 to $1,407 for $150,000 worth of coverage in Clark County

usecases: Assisting insured individuals with property and casualty claims
Providing public adjuster services in compliance with Florida statutes
public_adjuster_contract.solutions: Written contracts for public adjuster services, disclosure documents, and claim process explanations
key_features: Contracts must be in writing and prominently display fraud statement
Contracts must contain specific details such as names, addresses, and license numbers
Public adjuster must not receive compensation before insured receives an unaltered copy of the executed contract
Insured may rescind the contract if written estimate is not provided within 60 days
Separate disclosure document must be provided to the insured before signing the contract

public_adjuster.name: Missouri Department of Insurance
usecases: Adjustment or settlement of claims for losses or damages arising out of policies of fire or allied lines of insurances
public_adjuster.solutions: Licensing for public adjusters and public adjuster solicitors
public_adjuster.key_features: License Fee Waiver for Low Income, License Fee Waiver for Veterans, Search Enforcement Actions, Search Public Adjusters, Veterans reimbursement for licensing exams
